quote: The two leads sly comic rhythm is miles removed from the books failing solemnity.

quote: All those who still get a chill every time they step into a hotel shower say aye. That you see is the power of Psycho.

quote: What makes Psycho immortal when so many films are already half-forgotten as we leave the theater is that it connects directly with our fears.

quote: With the exception of Halloween no latter-day horror/thriller has been capable of generating as many goosebumps.

quote: [Hitchcocks] denouement falls quite flat for us. But the acting is fair.

quote: The film retains a huge nostalgic kick thanks in large part to Aykroyd and Belushis easy rapport a smattering of daft shaggy humour and some truly iconic musical sequences.

quote: The humor is predicated on underplaying in overscaled situations which is sporadically funny in a Keaton-esque way but soon sputters out through sheer uninspired repetition.

quote: Theres even room in the midst of the carnage and mayhem for a surprising amount of grace humor and whimsy.

quote: One of the most ambitious and brilliantly executed American films a landmark work from one of Hollywoods top cinema eras.

quote: The Paramount release has everything going for it.

quote: Francis Ford Coppola pulls it off in grand style.

quote: Few sequels have expanded upon the original with the faithfulness and detail of this one.

quote: If his considerable achievement in this long- awaited film falls short of his Olympian standards there is a reason that ought to give Kubrick some satisfaction. The world has caught up with Kubrick and what he has to say.

quote: This is the most tightly crafted Kubrick film since Dr. Strangelove as well as the most horrific; the first section alone accomplishes most of what The Shining failed to do.

quote: Although the elements of the story are simple and precise Kubrick infuses a dreamlike fatalistic quality.

quote: Full Metal Jacket ice and wildfire order and chaos is intellectual war hard thought.

quote: No one who sees Full Metal Jacket will easily put the films last glimpse of DOnofrio or a great many other things about Kubricks latest and most sobering vision out of mind.

quote: More questioning more agonized finally more humble.

quote: Everything about this remarkable production is exhilaratingly unexpected.

quote: As Mozart Tom Hulce though extremely American in looks and voice gets better and better as the drama progresses.

quote: In a film of grand gestures some of the finest moments are very subtle.

quote: Still a work of consummate artistry and craftsmanship.

quote: This is a robust romantic drama of a native-borns return to Ireland. Director John Ford took cast and cameras to Ireland to tell the story [by Maurice Walsh] against actual backgrounds.

quote: Sergio Leones languid lovely and lengthy ode to Lower East Side mobsters (more specifically mobster films) ...
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: As one would expect from Leone the film is a brilliant stylistic accomplishment.

quote: Seeing what Leone always intended is like getting your dirty glasses washed.

quote: De Niro is always absorbing and credible even when his character isnt.

quote: Martin Scorsese makes pictures about the kinds of people you wouldnt want to know.

quote: Unless Fellinis problem has been preying on the mind of the viewer he may not care to take on the directors doubts and confusions.
Its Fellinis last black-and-white picture and conceivably the most gorgeous and inventive thing he ever did.
Here is the author-director picture par excellence an exciting stimulating monumental creation.
Amiably spiking all criticism through a gloomy scriptwriter mouthpiece Fellini pulls a multitude of rabbits out of the showmans hat.
Here is a piece of entertainment that will really make you sit up straight and think a movie endowed with the challenge of a fascinating intellectual game.

Somehow the movie is more than the dated crisis of a naval-contemplating artist. Its about the inability in all of us to make sense of our lives put it all together and come up with something meaningful.
[Fellini] is that rare sort of artist who can be loved revered and just barely tolerated all at the same time.
The ensuing decades have brought forth a deluge of bogus masterpieces and Fellinis by comparison holds up rather well.

Its opening [has] perhaps the greatest dream scene of all: Marcello Mastroiannis Guido stifled in a silent traffic jam onlookers gazing blankly at him as he rises through the sunroof of his car high into the sky. The rest of the film isnt too shabby.
8 1/2 is the best film ever made about filmmaking.
As much as I admire the work of both Polanski and Nicholson I found Chinatown tedious from beginning to just before the end.

quote: Roman Polanskis American made film first since Rosemarys Baby shows him again in total command of talent and physical filmmaking elements.

quote: The hard-boiled private eye coolly strolls a few steps ahead of the audience.

quote: Night Watch is shabby chic with hints of Russias great silent-cinema past.
title: Night Watch (Nochnoi Dozor)

title: Batman Returns

quote: This is as tepid as two-hours-in-the-cup old tea.

quote: The picture is a pure exercise in directorial virtuosity.

title: Ladri di Biciclette (The Bicycle Thief) (Bicycle Thieves)

title: Ladri di Biciclette (The Bicycle Thief) (Bicycle Thieves)

title: Ladri di Biciclette (The Bicycle Thief) (Bicycle Thieves)

title: Ladri di Biciclette (The Bicycle Thief) (Bicycle Thieves)

title: Ladri di Biciclette (The Bicycle Thief) (Bicycle Thieves)

quote: What a beautiful and impressive job by first-time writer-director Courtney Hunt.
